song_name: Sending Postcards From a Plane Crash (Wish You Were Here)
lyrics:
30 contributorssending postcards from a plane crash wish you were here lyricsverse 1
i am such a sucker and im always the last to know
my insides are copper id kill to make them gold
conversation got me here another night alone in the city
so make my bed the grave and shovel dirt onto my sheets

chorus
every friend we ever had in common
i will sever the tie sever the tie with you
you can thank your lucky stars
everything i wish for will never come true

postchorus
when you go i will forget everything about you
when you go i will forget everything about you

verse 2
i have seen sinking ships go down
with more grace than you
turn this up ill tune you out another night alone in the city yeah
fake it like you matter thats a lie we can both keep oh

i will sever the tie sever the tie with you
you can thank your lucky stars
everything i wish for will never come true
see fall out boy liveget tickets as low as 20you might also likepostchorus

i will forget when you go i will forget everything about you
when you go i will forget everything about you
